txt.en: Instance: Invitation for a Drink
'I cannot believe it. Are you working with the Dunlending?'
'Who are you talking to?'
'They have offered to do great things for this city and its people.'
'It is good to sit and have a drink with you again.'
'They came for you, [placeholder]. And now I take my leave.'
'[placeholder], how nice of you to join us.'
'There are some who have sought my attention.'
'The Dunlending have more claim to this land than the Rohirrim.'
'Yes, we have not taken time for this for too long.'
'Have you abandoned reason?'
'You have clearly made up your mind. I tried to save you from this fate.'
'I can arrange for you to meet them, as you should hear what they have to say.'
'Have you forgotten how many years they were mis-treated, ridiculed and exiled?'
'You are too quick to judge. There are two sides to every story.'
'I assume Herubrand is mostly healed by now?'
'It is time to return to Herubrand with Calin's body, and inform him of what happened here.'
'He is doing better.'
'Dunlending ruffians have entered the tavern in an attempt to ambush anyone inside.'
'You will not like the answer to that question...'
'Calin, we worked together with Reeve Heremond for a long time.'
'The ones quietly pillaging our fair city and killing our people?'
'They were here long before the Rohirrim came.'
'We have not seen you come by for some time. What has occupied you?'
